address: Xã Duy Nghĩa, Huyện Duy Xuyên, Tỉnh Quảng Nam
thought:
**Mapping Old Vietnamese Address to New Administrative Unit**

Okay, so I'm tasked with figuring out the new address for an old one: Xã Duy Nghĩa, Huyện Duy Xuyên, Tỉnh Quảng Nam. This requires dissecting these provincial resolutions and the new ward data.

First, I identified the components of the old address. I've got the ward, district, and province. Then, I turned to the provincial resolutions. I quickly checked if Quảng Nam was on the "do not merge" list. Nope. Then, I found it listed for a merger: Quảng Nam merged with Đà Nẵng, becoming Đà Nẵng. This is important.

Next, I zeroed in on the resolutions specific to Đà Nẵng, resolution 1659/NQ-UBTVQH15 to be precise, because the new province will be the important one to target, and as it covers the areas from the merger. I focused on it because it directly deals with ward-level administrative changes in Đà Nẵng. And here, I found the key line: line 60 of the resolution. It explicitly mentions that the old Xã Duy Nghĩa is folded into a *new* Xã Duy Nghĩa. Perfect! This confirms that the old ward will continue to bear the same name in the new system. It also consolidates it with other local wards.

Then, I checked the new ward data provided, and there was a perfect match. The new data shows a "Xã Duy Nghĩa" with "Thành phố Đà Nẵng" as the province. So, I have found a solution.

The other provided new ward, "Xã Duy Xuyên," is not relevant to this address. The previous ward was "Xã Duy Nghĩa", and these wards were merged to be only one ward.

citation.header: 1659/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của thành phố Đà Nẵng
citation.line: 60. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của các xã Duy Thành, Duy Hải và Duy Nghĩa thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Duy Nghĩa.
